page.title: 02Using the Hexton land
page.content: In our area the land varies between {flat,undulating and hilly.}The highest view point is 183m at co_ordinates 10,28. The highest farmed point is at 150m.The soil is crumbly and{chalky.} Most of the land is owned by the Hexton Manor Estate which belongs to the Ashley_Cooper family who farm most of it. Some land is worked by tenant farmers at Mortgrove and Barton Hill Farms. A small area is owned by the Crown and worked by Pond Farm.{Barley and{wheat}are the main crops.{Rape, {peas}and{beans}are also grown. Barley is grown for malting and animal feed; wheat is grown for flour which is particularly made into biscuits, and for animal feed. Beans feed pigeons and animals. Peas are tinned for people to eat and are also used for animal feed. Rape produces food oil.
